programme.title: Happy International Women's Day!
programme.desc: Happy International Women's Day! We're celebrating with a non-stop playlist full of our favourite female music stars!.

programme.title: 25 Biggest Female Anthems
programme.desc: Here come the girls! We celebrate the biggest female voices in music.

programme.title: Happy International Women's Day!
programme.desc: Happy International Women's Day! We're celebrating with a non-stop playlist full of our favourite female music stars!.

programme.title: Girl Power Anthems
programme.desc: Girl Power has been going strong since the 90s, and these timeless pop anthems are proof that it's here to stay.

programme.title: Bad Teacher (2011)
programme.desc: Cynical, hard-drinking teacher Elizabeth Halsey hates her job and the kids in her class, and hopes to escape her daily grind by landing a rich husband. A wealthy substitute seems like a suitable candidate, but she has a rival for his attention in a squeaky-clean colleague. Comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Justin Timberlake, Jason Segel and Lucy Punch.

programme.title: Katie Price's Mucky Mansion
programme.desc: Katie creates her own makeup room and brings new life to the shabby stables. After spotting a paparazzi photographer, she takes a moment to reflect on how these moments impact her mental health.

programme.title: Sex Actually with Alice Levine
programme.desc: Alice travels from London to Washington, DC meeting people who are entering relationships with multiple partners in a bid for more sex and a deeper connection, including a 20-person polycule - a group of open-minded lovers who have created an ever-evolving support system through their intertwined sex lives. Back in the British suburbs, she meet a young married couple whose dalliances with other couples has helped strengthen their relationship.

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The architect explores an arts and crafts-inspired house in Surrey. Built in the 1920s, it has tall chimneys, leaded windows, gabled ends and a steeply pitched roof. Sadly, it has Artex everywhere and incorporates some dubious design alterations. He sets out to help its owners turn it back into an elegant home for themselves and their three children. George also tackles a suburban home that has so many layers of wallpaper that peeling them back is like going back through a time warp.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Oil and gas co-ordinator Danielle Greenwood is keen to impress as she hosts the first dinner party in the Merseyside area, as she welcomes divorcee Jade Chantelle Short, Michael Buble impersonator Jamie Somers, pastoral care manager Steven Booth, and nursery school teacher Anna Senior into her home. Danielle takes no risks with a down-to-earth menu, which she hopes will help bag her the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Pastoral care manager Steven Booth hosts the second Merseyside dinner party, and names each course after a Tina Turner song, hoping to win the £1,000 prize. The food is well received, but tensions rise when one guest makes a tactless comment.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Glamorous PR representative Jade Chantelle hosts the third night in Merseyside, where she hopes a casino-themed evening with lashings of champagne and a high-class menu will help her to win the £1,000 prize.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Primary school teacher Anna Senior hosts the fourth night in Merseyside with a fairy tale-themed evening. Her menu consists of a Mad Hatter's soup and sandwich, a special pork dish cooked three ways and baked cheesecake for dessert, but she must try to control the tension between Jamie and Jade to have a successful party.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Michael Bublé impersonator Jamie Somers hosts the final Merseyside dinner party, but may have to put aside his differences with guest Jade if he is to be crowned the winner of the £1,000 cash prize.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jon and Lynne Scopes from Stockport have thought about buying a property abroad for years and have viewed more than 40 apartments without success, but have at least decided their ideal area is Mijas on Spain's Costa del Sol. Jasmine Harman has the daunting task of finding them the perfect property for their £100,000 budget, but will anything meet their exacting standards?.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lou and Tony dream of buying their own Spanish holiday home to enjoy with all their family. They're looking for a house with great views and lots of outdoor space for Tony to exercise his green fingers on the Canary island of Tenerife. Jasmine Harman shows them five properties for their budget of £350,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Ali tries to keep her Spanish dream alive with a new business plan and Christine and Pete are having second thoughts just a year after opening their restaurant. In France, gite owners Lee and Zandra have their sights set on expansion.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Clairvoyant Yvette Tamara hosts the first dinner party in north Kent, and the night gets off to a spooky start when data analyst John Tower and working mother Yemi Christopher-Soares discover a ghost-busting machine. Meanwhile, jeweller Lisa Townend is so impressed with Yvette's abilities that she wants to return for a psychic reading.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Data analyst John Tower hosts the second dinner party in north Kent, and lets his passion for military re-enactment show when he barks orders at the table. However, not all the guests enjoy his fatty pork stew and psychedelic dessert, and two argue over dating etiquette.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Project manager Yemi Christopher-Soares hosts the third dinner party in north Kent, where she hopes the guests will enjoy her Nigerian-inspired menu and appreciate her love of all things spicy.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jono Simm hosts the penultimate dinner party in north Kent and is convinced his wholesome and hearty menu is the way to win. However, two of his guests are less than impressed by his cooking.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Party-loving Lisa Townend hosts the final dinner party in north Kent, and hopes that a menu full of French fancies and innovative entertainment in the form of human roulette, will be enough to impress her guests and see her crowned winner of the £1,000 cash prize.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Michelle and Charlotte from Stevenage are looking for Michelle's dream holiday home on Lanzarote. As a family of four, they have been coming to the island for more than 10 years and feel particularly at home in the seaside town of Playa Blanca. Ben Hillman lines up five properties for their £110,000 budget.

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: A tennis player is put into an induced coma after suffering a heart attack on the court, a fell runner is seriously injured by cows, and a man is crushed under a collapsed wall.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Celebrity photographer John wants to celebrate his 60th birthday by relocating to the idyllic Greek Island of Skopelos. Having fallen in love with its beautiful scenery and relaxing way of life, all he needs is to find his dream property - so friend Helen is coming along for support. Ben Hillman selects five options to put in the frame for his £120,000 budget, hoping at least one will be John's idea of perfection.

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: It's the semi-final and the potters are making pieces for the bathroom before taking on the iconic Moorcroft tube lining in the surprise second challenge.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics are back to tuck into their takeaways while watching the best of the week's TV and streaming output, sharing their thoughts for the rest of the viewing public to see.

programme.title: George Michael: Outed
programme.desc: Part one of two. How the singer's outing was a landmark moment in gay politics, with a potential career-ending scandal being averted by seizing control of the media narrative. The first episode looks back at the singer's early career, and unearths the reasons he felt compelled to remain in the closet in the first place. Featuring contributions from former manager Simon Napier-Bell and Rev Richard Coles, who recalls his own experiences of being a gay man and a pop star in the 1980s.

programme.title: George Michael: Outed
programme.desc: Part two of two. How George Michael announced his sexuality to the world in 1998 and the events that led to it including losing his partner to an Aids-related illness, being arrested for committing a lewd act in a public toilet and threats from the News of the World to publish pictures of him cruising in a park. Will Young shares how the events gave hope to young gay men at the time.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The Operational Support Unit has to evade a guard dog when carrying out a drugs raid on a farm, while a driver thinks he can pull a fast one by impersonating his brother. Barry finds himself dealing with an irate nightclubber, Craggy has an early morning encounter with a polecat and it is a case of deja vu for Dan as he deals with the same person twice in one shift.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Twenty officers descend on a hotel to arrest members of a criminal gang in their beds, Jon and Maya raid a cannabis farm, and Craggy and Phil catch a serial bacon snatcher. Three police cars and a helicopter take on a teenage van thief, Sgt Carlin stops a driver who has a gun hidden behind his seat, and Brian reduces a time-wasting motorist to a blubbering wreck.

programme.title: Fights, Camera, Action!
programme.desc: Footage of fights taking place on the street and in public places, including an incident in Manchester where a man's comments prompt a strong reaction from a woman in a crowd.

programme.title: Doomsday: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A team of veteran firefighters become trapped inside their truck during a raging wildfire. A mother tries to escape from an erupting volcano.

programme.title: Red Arrows: Kings of the Sky
programme.sub-title: The Red Arrows: A Year in the Sky
programme.desc: Two pilots from the famous squadron attempt a series of hair-raising manoeuvres for the first time as the team begin their intense winter training ahead of the RAF centenary celebrations. This episode also takes a look behind the breathtaking action, and follows the efforts of the ground teams as they practice, plan and prepare for the shows.

programme.title: Winter Road Rescue
programme.desc: In the Highlands, as heavy rain turns to driving snow, council snowplough drivers fight to keep the Applecross Pass open.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After two turbulent nautically themed rounds, two bladesmiths head the final round to forge the Kachin Dao, a deadly headhunting sword.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: West Yorkshire officers take action against a teenage driver after he leads them on a high-speed chase across Roundhay Park in Leeds, while the cops also face a battle to keep up with uninsured drivers who flout the law without fear of consequence.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers swoop on a housing estate searching for suspects involved in a shooting and it needs to be a tightly controlled operation and communication is key between the firearms unit, police helicopters and dog handler Duncan. Elsewhere, Steve responds to reports of a burglary in progress, and ends up on a chase through back gardens. After catching one of the suspects, Steve receives a shock when he returns to check out the burgled house.

programme.title: Damn the Defiant! (1962)
programme.desc: The commander of a British warship fighting in the Napoleonic campaign faces bitter opposition from his right-hand man, a cruel and sadistic officer hated by the crew. In a battle of wills between the pair, the captain's second-in-command tries to provoke his leader's wrath by tormenting his son, an officer on the vessel. Drama, starring Alec Guinness, Dirk Bogarde and Anthony Quayle.

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.

programme.title: Damn the Defiant! (1962)

programme.title: Flaming Star (1960)
programme.desc: The son of a Native American mother and a white father faces a test of loyalties when he is caught on the racial divide as a Kiowa tribe go on the warpath and white settlers carry out brutal reprisal attacks. Whereas he is drawn to side with his mother's people, his half-brother takes the opposing view. Western, starring Elvis Presley, Steve Forrest, Barbara Eden, Richard Jaeckel and Dolores Del Rio.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four competitors look to secure a place in the final where they will be tasked with forging intricate Renaissance side-arm, the Katzbalger.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The officers deal with a number of uninsured drivers, including one who leads them on a 35-minute chase and another who flees the scene of a rush-hour crash, earning himself a full-scale investigation for his trouble. Then in Bradford, a crackdown on road offences leads to the officers nabbing another insurance avoider, but tensions run high as a result.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Charlie and Wayne are in hot pursuit of a van, but the driver crashes the vehicle and runs off into the night. With the help of a tracker, officers hunt down a 17-year-old suspected of committing a serious robbery, while Matt and Brimmers are on the hunt for the driver of a £300,000 Rolls-Royce who is thought to be under the influence.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A high-powered Porsche is pursued by eight police cars and a helicopter, while Officers Ben P and Ben B attend a crash scene where a car has flipped over and landed on its roof, and their difficult job is made harder by a crowd filming the aftermath of the accident on their phones.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: In North Yorkshire, officers are out in force protecting lorry drivers and their cargoes as organised gangs target goods and trucks travelling through the county. Near York, when a suspicious empty lorry is spotted on an industrial estate, police believe it's being used to transport stolen goods from another vehicle. On the outskirts of Leeds, a police helicopter is called in to help search for suspected fuel thieves hiding out in the woods after fleeing from an abandoned stolen car packed with more than 20 empty barrels ready to be filled with diesel.

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds (2000)
programme.desc: A veteran car thief is forced out of retirement to steal 50 top-of-the-range vehicles in exchange for his brother's life. While his sibling is held hostage by a sadistic gangster, he asks his former cronies to help - but with the clock ticking and just a few days remaining to pull off the daunting task, their chances of success are hanging by a thread. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, Angelina Jolie, Giovanni Ribisi and Robert Duvall.

Action thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Sam Worthington.

Whereas he is drawn to side with his mother's people, his half-brother takes the opposing view. Western, starring Elvis Presley, Steve Forrest, Barbara Eden, Richard Jaeckel and Dolores Del Rio.

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four competitors look to secure a place in the final where they will be tasked with forging intricate Renaissance side-arm, the Katzbalger.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The officers deal with a number of uninsured drivers, including one who leads them on a 35-minute chase and another who flees the scene of a rush-hour crash, earning himself a full-scale investigation for his trouble. Then in Bradford, a crackdown on road offences leads to the officers nabbing another insurance avoider, but tensions run high as a result.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Charlie and Wayne are in hot pursuit of a van, but the driver crashes the vehicle and runs off into the night. With the help of a tracker, officers hunt down a 17-year-old suspected of committing a serious robbery, while Matt and Brimmers are on the hunt for the driver of a £300,000 Rolls-Royce who is thought to be under the influence.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A high-powered Porsche is pursued by eight police cars and a helicopter, while Officers Ben P and Ben B attend a crash scene where a car has flipped over and landed on its roof, and their difficult job is made harder by a crowd filming the aftermath of the accident on their phones.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: In North Yorkshire, officers are out in force protecting lorry drivers and their cargoes as organised gangs target goods and trucks travelling through the county. Near York, when a suspicious empty lorry is spotted on an industrial estate, police believe it's being used to transport stolen goods from another vehicle. On the outskirts of Leeds, a police helicopter is called in to help search for suspected fuel thieves hiding out in the woods after fleeing from an abandoned stolen car packed with more than 20 empty barrels ready to be filled with diesel.

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds (2000)
programme.desc: A veteran car thief is forced out of retirement to steal 50 top-of-the-range vehicles in exchange for his brother's life. While his sibling is held hostage by a sadistic gangster, he asks his former cronies to help - but with the clock ticking and just a few days remaining to pull off the daunting task, their chances of success are hanging by a thread. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, Angelina Jolie, Giovanni Ribisi and Robert Duvall.

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds (2000)
programme.desc: A veteran car thief is forced out of retirement to steal 50 top-of-the-range vehicles in exchange for his brother's life. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, Angelina Jolie, Giovanni Ribisi and Robert Duvall.

programme.title: Sabotage (2014)
programme.desc: The members of an elite Drug Enforcement Administration team secretly keep the millions of dollars they find during the raid. When they are killed off one by one, the leader becomes convinced one of his men is getting rid of the others to keep all the money, and sets out to expose the murderer. Action thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Sam Worthington.

programme.title: Great British Ships
programme.sub-title: Queen Mary: Britain's First Luxury Liner
programme.desc: Rob Bell investigates the history of ocean liner the SS Queen Mary, finding out how the largest ship of its day could also become the fastest - achieving speeds that few large ships can match even 80 years later. On the passenger decks, he savours the art deco craftsmanship that made the vessel the much-loved 'floating gentleman's club', where royalty rubbed shoulders with movie stars.

programme.title: The Thames at Night with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: The latest leg of the presenter's journey begins in Greenwich, with behind-the-scenes access to the Royal Observatory on the banks of the Thames. Tony discovers the vital role the observatory played in helping sailors navigate the globe. And he has a unique opportunity to view the planet Mars as the Victorians would have seen it - through Britain's largest refracting telescope.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: In 2015, Julia Pryke from South Africa and her British husband Gareth Shone bought a £3,000 derelict two-room farmhouse via the internet. They had never visited eastern Europe before, but wanted to lead a low-impact life and be as self-sufficient as possible. Ben Fogle meets them at the property in Gadacs, a traditional village in the Somogy county of rural Hungary, helps install a window and assists then as they try to buy chickens in the local market.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A woman is rushed to hospital when doctors suspect she is suffering from an ectopic pregnancy and a young girl is treated for hormonal acne after starting her period. Dr Daniel Caris has to remove a sebaceous cyst from a patient's back and a patient suffering from a fever is given antibiotics.

programme.desc: A widowed mother's life takes a deadly turn when she witnesses a murder gone awry.

programme.title: Fatal Mind Games (2022)
programme.desc: A widowed mother's life takes a deadly turn when she witnesses a murder gone awry.

programme.title: Friends Who Kill (2020)
programme.desc: Teenager Lacy seeks solace from her parents' divorce with the help of a new friend, who wins her mother's approval while rapidly driving away all her other friends. A spurned classmate digs up some dirt on the newcomer, which Lacy dismisses as jealousy - but soon begins to realise her friend is concealing a horrific past. Thriller, starring Natalie Brown and Sarah Fisher.

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.

programme.title: Friends Who Kill (2020)
programme.desc: Teenager Lacy seeks solace from her parents' divorce with the help of a new friend, who wins her mother's approval while rapidly driving away all her other friends. A spurned classmate digs up some dirt on the newcomer, which Lacy dismisses as jealousy - but soon begins to realise her friend is concealing a horrific past. Thriller, starring Natalie Brown and Sarah Fisher.

programme.title: Holiday Homes in the Sun
programme.desc: Amanda Lamb, JB Gill and Sam Pinkham visit Ravello on the Neapolitan Riviera, competing to find the area's best holiday homes for a classic Italian retreat. JB starts in style with a hillside apartment for two with a view to die for, a private lemon grove and enough pantheon and limoncello thrown in to keep Amanda and Sam happy.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: A farmer brings in one of his much-loved semi-feral cats for treatment, with tricky surgery required to remove a lump on its face that could be a life-threatening tumour. Julian helps ewe Vera to give birth, while Peter and Sarah encounter Alfie, a cocky young donkey who has unusual parenting issues.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: In the Arctic Circle, the explorer meets Randi, the first Norwegian woman to climb Everest ahead of his own bid to scale the world's highest mountain. He embraces the tough and basic life on her 8.5 acre island by sleeping outdoors, and collecting raw building materials. Ben also experiences sea kayaking, and witnesses the northern lights.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: The adventurer meets more people who have turned their backs on the rat-race and set up home in some of the most remote locations on Earth. This week, Ben travels to the vast forests of the Rhodope Mountains in Bulgaria to join Miriam and Peter, a couple who have chosen life as nomads, hiking through some of the world's most striking wildernesses. They are educated but unemployed and homeless - and it's just the way they like it. Having previously walked the length of New Zealand in 2016, Ben now finds the duo on an intrepid journey across South Eastern Europe.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Steam Railway: All Aboard
programme.desc: Preparations are under way for Yorkshire Day, including a special Yorkshire-themed Pullman service, with Gill and husband Paul getting hands-on sorting out the event. There is also another big occasion on the horizon and Tim is organising the wedding of head boilersmith Mark and his equally steam-mad fiancée Emma. Their love blossomed because of mutual passion for steam, and in particular the B1, so they want the engine to pull them on their wedding train, but issues with the engine means it might miss the big day.

programme.title: Ancient Mysteries
programme.desc: Archaeologist Renee Friedman discusses the discovery of an ancient Egyptian cemetery for wild animals, and what it reveals about the origins of animal gods in the nation's culture.

programme.title: The Pompeii Prophecy: Countdown to Devastation
programme.desc: With reference to the eruption of Mount Vesuvius that destroyed the cities of Pompeii and Herculaneum, investigators hunt for clues hidden beneath the surface to assess the risk of a new and potentially devastating event of equal magnitude. This documentary follows historians and geologists as they discover the latest evidence of Pompeii's fiery destruction, unpacking the chain of events that led to the ancient world's most notorious disaster in AD 79. What lessons does the tragedy of Pompeii hold for Naples' citizens, who face a mounting threat from the unseen forces beneath their feet?.

programme.title: Atlantis: Hunt for the Lost Civilisation
programme.desc: Film-makers Simcha Jacobovici and James Cameron and a group of archaeologists, scientists and historians embark on a search for the true location of the fabled lost city with the aid of a virtual map gleaned from the works of Plato. Their quest also makes use of archaeological finds, satellite photographs, manuscripts and underwater exploration as they attempt to get to the bottom of the story.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Bladesmiths forge a bayonet for a rifle, and the final two smiths spend five days creating African blade the Zulu Iklwa.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four custom knifemakers compete to make the best usable knife through a series of challenges and bladesmiths craft the classic Greek Xiphos Sword.

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: The crimes of serial killer Dennis Nilsen, who was arrested in February 1983 after human remains were found in his household drains. It was later discovered he had liked to bathe and dress his victims' corpses, and was guilty of killing at least 12 young men in and around his home in the north London district of Muswell Hill.

programme.title: Dirty Home Rescue
programme.desc: e, Hayley Leitch and her cleaning team go to the rescue of Linda and Andy from Bedau in South Wales, whose house is overrun with animals and hasn't been cleaned in four years.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A patient complaining of a bloody cough suspects the toxic fumes of a bonfire, but Dr Amir Khan thinks it could be tuberculosis, which is still a health issue in Bradford. Dr Khan also treats a woman with a bloodshot eye, while Dr Saeed sees a man whose back pain is so bad he is struggling to walk. Meanwhile, in the minor ops room, Dr Chris Harris performs a vasectomy.

programme.title: Bargain Brits on Benefits
programme.desc: Cameras follow bulk buyer Zana, who shops for the biggest offers, and Allan, who has invested in a yacht to live a champagne lifestyle on a lemonade budget.

programme.title: Rich Kids, Skint Holiday
programme.desc: Seventeen-year-old Dasha from Worcestershire, who is accustomed to the finest things in life, joins Kate Harris and five of her eight kids on a basic camping trip to west Wales.

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Cameras catch up with Yorkshire-born chip shop owner 'John the Fish', who spends his week chopping, frying, battering and bantering with his cousin Jamie.

programme.title: Call the Bailiffs: Time to Pay Up
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of enforcement agents as they execute High Court writs on behalf of people desperate to recover money they are owed.

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Stavros and Emily try to get their house back from squatters, while Margaret attempts to recover the £20,000 she is owed from a letting agent, and Peterborough council find 12 people crammed into a category-one fire hazard house. Documentary series in which cameras follow the victims and villains of the buy-to-let boom.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: PC Andy Swift is on the lookout for a high-value car stolen from a dealership after being taken for a test drive, while he also searches for builder's van taken from a driveway while the owner popped briefly inside to collect his tools and equipment. PC Dave Shaw is patrolling on a night shift when he follows a car suspected of being used in house burglary.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: PC Tom Strachan gives pursuit when a car is spotted by police cameras being driven with no insurance, but when records flag up the suspect has a history of violence, an armed response team is called in too. The suspect throws a knife out of the car and then waves a baseball bat out of his window, banging it on the roof and making offensive hand gestures at the police behind him.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers try to track down the criminals responsible for robbing a supermarket. Elsewhere, an interceptor is unconvinced when a disqualified driver pretends to be someone else, and a rude biker is taken to task.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The police helicopter team pursues an armed robber trying to evade arrest, and new recruits put their detective skills to the test by apprehending suspected burglars. PC Russ Gay tries to calm down a group of unruly drunken youths and Zippy the sniffer dog makes an interesting discovery inside a stolen car.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The Essex unit pulls over an angry driver and a car thief leads officers on a cross-country chase. The air support team pursues an athletic burglar and a vehicle with a burst tyre, while other interceptors search for a lost key and are forced to arrest a colleague.

programme.title: Call the Bailiffs: Time to Pay Up
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of enforcement agents as they execute High Court writs on behalf of people desperate to recover money they are owed.

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Feeling trapped, Bree secretly reaches out for help, only to be discovered by Jacob. Dean is surprised by a face from his past, and Remi takes matters into his own hands.

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Bree stands her ground as she tries to free herself from Jacob's control, while Mackenzie's nursery masterpiece is revealed, but then a mysterious appearance gives her a fright.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Gareth James treats his first-ever case of 'whiplash by canine', while the GPs also speak to a man whose family is struggling to cope with his self-harm and suicidal thoughts. Plus, Mohammed is told that he is at high risk of heart disease, and Aisha is warned about her acne medication's side-effects.

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: Dr Julian Humphrey and Sister Benita Wainwright treat Phil, who has the rare condition aortic dissection, while Dr Humphrey also tries to put a man's dislocated shoulder into place. Consultant Dr Bharath Reddy and junior Dr George Kay are on standby to treat 14-month-old Heaven, who is rushed in with breathing problems, while volunteer Jane keeps the team and patients fed and watered.

programme.title: Deja Vu (2006)
programme.desc: A federal agent investigating the bombing of a ferryboat in New Orleans is given access by the government to a top-secret device that allows him to see into the past. He focuses on one victim in particular, a woman whom he believes holds the key to the crime, and becomes convinced that he can prevent the explosion ever happening. Sci-fi thriller, with Denzel Washington, Paula Patton, Val Kilmer and Jim Caviezel.

Jonathan Demme's remake of the 1962 thriller, with Denzel Washington, Liev Schreiber, Meryl Streep and Jon Voight.

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: An aspiring author is murdered, setting in motion an investigation full of unexpected twists and turns. The victim's criminal boyfriend seems a likely suspect, but proves to have a rock-solid alibi - and inquiries later lead Goren and Eames to a celebrated writer whose career has gone into decline. Crime drama, guest starring Peter Coyote, with Vincent D'Onofrio.

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Logan and Falacci investigate the murder of a grand jury witness, and uncover serious flaws in the case against a group of American footballers accused of rape. As inquiries proceed, suspicion falls on the motives of an ambitious Bronx assistant DA and his wife, who have a lot riding on the outcome of the trial. Crime drama, starring Chris Noth and Alicia Witt.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The discovery of a child's body sends Stabler and Cragen in search of a suspected paedophile, but important medical evidence emerges that implicates someone close to the child. Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Dann Florek.

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Exhausted by a European book tour, Jessica stops off to see an old friend who owns a luxurious Monte Carlo hotel, but it is not long before a murderer checks in. Ian Ogilvy guest stars, with Angela Lansbury.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Muslim US Marine is found seemingly shot dead near a mosque that has been linked to an al-Qaeda recruiter. Ducky refuses to perform an autopsy out of respect for the man's religion, but Abby runs tests that reveal his demise was actually due to poisoning from a rare octopus venom. Meanwhile, McGee goes into the mosque intending to plant a concealed microphone - but discovers someone has had the same idea.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team set up a stake-out at a storage facility to catch a thief suspected of selling hi-tech Navy equipment on the black market, but end up witnessing a murder. To make matters worse, $90million worth of radar gear goes missing while they are distracted. Meanwhile, Ducky asks Abby to run a series of mysterious blood tests, raising suspicions that he is harbouring a secret.

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A suspect in a drug-smuggling case is seemingly mauled to death by his own dog, which is immediately scheduled to be destroyed - but Abby refuses to hand it over to Navy officials and launches her own investigation. Meanwhile, Gibbs continues to worry about Shepard's health, convinced she and Ducky are hiding something. Drama, starring Pauley Perrette, Mark Harmon and Lauren Holly.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A traffic collision that resulted in multiple fatalities is seemingly caused by a drink driver, but that theory is dismissed as Lupo and Bernard's investigation gets under way. The detectives discover a nasal spray that has been spiked to disorient its user and learn a pharmaceutical company worker was intending to disclose sensitive details about her employer - so the duo try to track down her boss.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A key witness in a murder trial is found dead outside her hotel room, and Lupo and Bernard's investigation embroils them in a conspiracy involving black-market dealings, drug cartels and corrupt officials. With the lives of other witnesses in danger, Rubirosa finds herself caught in the crossfire.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Detectives Lupo and Bernard investigate when a community activist is murdered. Meanwhile, Van Buren gets bad news from former detective Ray Curtis. Police drama, starring Jeremy Sisto, Anthony Anderson and S Epatha Merkerson.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A harmless tramp is attacked by an over-zealous vigilante and left for dead in a deserted alley, sending Briscoe and Logan in pursuit of his assailant. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Christopher Noth.

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A famous rock star is acquitted of raping a fan after the victim's claims are rejected. Logan and Briscoe decide to investigate further, and discover the musician's pleasant reputation does not quite match his personality. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A serial killer begins posting footage of his crimes online - and as the agents investigate, they realise that each film contains visual clues to the identity of the next victim. In a further bizarre twist, Abby later finds what seems to be a new video on her computer - and the case takes on fresh urgency with the discovery that it is actually a live feed, suggesting the murderer is somewhere on the premises.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bank at Quantico is robbed and a security guard killed, but the team soon discovers that stealing money may not have been the perpetrators' primary objective. Meanwhile, Gibbs is given the task of evaluating an inexperienced new agent assigned by Vance to help investigate the case. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Rey Valentin.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs sends DiNozzo and Ziva to retrieve top-secret information from a secure military base - a mission aimed at catching a mole in the NCIS ranks. Unfortunately, it soon becomes clear that the traitor is still at large - so the building is locked down and all agents are rounded up in a final effort to catch the culprit. Guest starring Jude Ciccolella.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team struggles to locate a suspect following the murder of an eight-year-old boy whose body is found on a hiking trail in Pennsylvania. As the case develops and the number of victims increases, two more children go missing in the same area, and the agents work quickly to stop the pair becoming the killer's next targets.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU is sent to Las Cruces, New Mexico, to investigate a series of murders within a gated community. Three women have been strangled in the past two months, and when the team discovers that no non-residents were present at the time of the last killing, they employ FBI agent Ashley Seaver to root out the criminal.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: An assistant district attorney is found strangled in his car in an area notorious for prostitution. Benson is shocked to realise she briefly dated the victim and refuses to believe he would have paid for sex. As investigations get under way, DNA evidence reveals the dead man might have been gay. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The rape and murder of a criminology student puts detectives Stabler and Benson on the trail of a killer with an expert knowledge of forensics. A discovery about the victim's mentor places him at the top of their list of suspects - but as further evidence is gathered, it begins to seem that someone might have tried to frame him for the crime.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a six-year-old boy who is believed to have collapsed during an exorcism at a late-night church service. However, forensics reveal the victim was smothered before the rite took place, casting suspicion on his foster parents and social worker. Starring Christopher Meloni, Ice-T and Richard Belzer.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The police discover a 12-year-old boy posted sinister threats to a girl in an internet chatroom and suspect his anger stems from sexual abuse. The trail soon leads Benson and Stabler to a billionaire known for his generous donations to charities and his hospitality to young house guests.

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: An aspiring author is murdered, setting in motion an investigation full of unexpected twists and turns. The victim's criminal boyfriend seems a likely suspect, but proves to have a rock-solid alibi - and inquiries later lead Goren and Eames to a celebrated writer whose career has gone into decline. Crime drama, guest starring Peter Coyote, with Vincent D'Onofrio.

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Logan and Falacci investigate the murder of a grand jury witness, and uncover serious flaws in the case against a group of American footballers accused of rape. As inquiries proceed, suspicion falls on the motives of an ambitious Bronx assistant DA and his wife, who have a lot riding on the outcome of the trial. Crime drama, starring Chris Noth and Alicia Witt.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The discovery of a child's body sends Stabler and Cragen in search of a suspected paedophile, but important medical evidence emerges that implicates someone close to the child. Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Dann Florek.

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Exhausted by a European book tour, Jessica stops off to see an old friend who owns a luxurious Monte Carlo hotel, but it is not long before a murderer checks in. Ian Ogilvy guest stars, with Angela Lansbury.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Muslim US Marine is found seemingly shot dead near a mosque that has been linked to an al-Qaeda recruiter. Ducky refuses to perform an autopsy out of respect for the man's religion, but Abby runs tests that reveal his demise was actually due to poisoning from a rare octopus venom. Meanwhile, McGee goes into the mosque intending to plant a concealed microphone - but discovers someone has had the same idea.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team set up a stake-out at a storage facility to catch a thief suspected of selling hi-tech Navy equipment on the black market, but end up witnessing a murder. To make matters worse, $90million worth of radar gear goes missing while they are distracted. Meanwhile, Ducky asks Abby to run a series of mysterious blood tests, raising suspicions that he is harbouring a secret.

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A suspect in a drug-smuggling case is seemingly mauled to death by his own dog, which is immediately scheduled to be destroyed - but Abby refuses to hand it over to Navy officials and launches her own investigation. Meanwhile, Gibbs continues to worry about Shepard's health, convinced she and Ducky are hiding something. Drama, starring Pauley Perrette, Mark Harmon and Lauren Holly.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A traffic collision that resulted in multiple fatalities is seemingly caused by a drink driver, but that theory is dismissed as Lupo and Bernard's investigation gets under way. The detectives discover a nasal spray that has been spiked to disorient its user and learn a pharmaceutical company worker was intending to disclose sensitive details about her employer - so the duo try to track down her boss.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A key witness in a murder trial is found dead outside her hotel room, and Lupo and Bernard's investigation embroils them in a conspiracy involving black-market dealings, drug cartels and corrupt officials. With the lives of other witnesses in danger, Rubirosa finds herself caught in the crossfire.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Detectives Lupo and Bernard investigate when a community activist is murdered. Meanwhile, Van Buren gets bad news from former detective Ray Curtis. Police drama, starring Jeremy Sisto, Anthony Anderson and S Epatha Merkerson.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A harmless tramp is attacked by an over-zealous vigilante and left for dead in a deserted alley, sending Briscoe and Logan in pursuit of his assailant. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Christopher Noth.

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A famous rock star is acquitted of raping a fan after the victim's claims are rejected. Logan and Briscoe decide to investigate further, and discover the musician's pleasant reputation does not quite match his personality. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A serial killer begins posting footage of his crimes online - and as the agents investigate, they realise that each film contains visual clues to the identity of the next victim. In a further bizarre twist, Abby later finds what seems to be a new video on her computer - and the case takes on fresh urgency with the discovery that it is actually a live feed, suggesting the murderer is somewhere on the premises.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bank at Quantico is robbed and a security guard killed, but the team soon discovers that stealing money may not have been the perpetrators' primary objective. Meanwhile, Gibbs is given the task of evaluating an inexperienced new agent assigned by Vance to help investigate the case. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Rey Valentin.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs sends DiNozzo and Ziva to retrieve top-secret information from a secure military base - a mission aimed at catching a mole in the NCIS ranks. Unfortunately, it soon becomes clear that the traitor is still at large - so the building is locked down and all agents are rounded up in a final effort to catch the culprit. Guest starring Jude Ciccolella.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team struggles to locate a suspect following the murder of an eight-year-old boy whose body is found on a hiking trail in Pennsylvania. As the case develops and the number of victims increases, two more children go missing in the same area, and the agents work quickly to stop the pair becoming the killer's next targets.

programme.title: Saina ()
programme.desc: A tale essaying the unbreakable spirit of the former world no. badminton champion, Saina Nehwal, who was determined to rise from the ashes.

programme.title: Dil Hi To Hai (1992)
programme.desc: A prince travels to a city in disguise to find a wife who will love him for his personality rather than his riches. Drama, starring Jackie Shroff, Divya Bharati and Kader Khan.

programme.title: Khel ()
programme.desc: Three fraudsters trick a rich elderly woman, Sulakshana, who is desperately looking for her long-lost grandchild, in order to acquire her estate and property..

programme.title: Happy Hardy and Heer ()
programme.desc: Happy loves Heer, but she considers him to be just a good friend. When Heer moves to London and falls in love with Hardy, Happy vows to do everything possible to win her heart..

programme.title: Baazigar (1993)
programme.desc: A man plots revenge on the businessman who betrayed his father. He intends to seduce and kill both the tycoon's daughters. The first murder is successfully covered up as a suicide, but the victim's sister becomes suspicious and seeks the aid of a police inspector in discovering the truth. Crime thriller, starring Shahrukh Khan, Kajol and Shilpa Shetty.

programme.title: Su Pic (Peek Zoo)
programme.desc: It's such a hot day at Sù Pìc that even the penguins get special ice pops to cool themselves right down.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Coco suggests the friends all play Big Bad Wolf together when Bing builds a house with the sofa cushions.

programme.title: Nannag a' Noo/Huggleboo
programme.desc: Huggleboo and Zizou put together a circus performance.

programme.title: Abadas
programme.desc: Ben challenges the Abadas to find a special creature shaped like a star.

programme.title: Peataichean/Pets
programme.desc: Eilidh Cormack meets Angus and his four cats.

programme.title: Pip & Posy
programme.desc: After Pip and Posy compete in a wheelbarrow race, they aren’t in a good frame of mind with one another. How will they get over this?.

programme.title: Stòiridh
programme.desc: Mary Ann Kennedy reads Dachaigh Ùr do Shionnach Beag by Janet Bingham, illustrated by Rosalind Beardshaw and translated into Gaelic by Jo Macdonald.

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda
programme.desc: Po goes on an undercover misean at the prison, disguised as the criminal mastermind, Sheng.

programme.title: An Sgoil
programme.desc: Cameras return to Sgoil Taobh na Cloiche for a new term and a lot has happened. The in-service day was not as successful as Mr Mackle had hoped and Ms Sharpe has made the newspapers after what happened at the Mòd.

programme.title: Saidheans Sporsail (Backyard Science)
programme.desc: Fun science experiments, including how to eavesdrop on friends using a super spy listening device and bend a ball like David Beckham.

programme.title: Dealbhan Fraoich (Heather's Portraits)
programme.desc: Heather Dewar draws a charcoal portrait of teacher Janet MacDonald.

programme.title: SpeakGaelic
programme.desc: Joy Dunlop guides viewers through the first steps of speaking Gaelic.

programme.title: An Là (News)
programme.desc: Local, national and international news and information from BBC Alba.

programme.title: Miann na Maighdinn-mara/Mermaid Tales
programme.desc: Kate Macleod goes deep sea swimming, visits a deserted village with a history going back thousands of years and makes a discovery at the bottom of a loch.

programme.title: Ionad Hiort - Oir an Dochais/St Kilda Centre - Edge of Hope
programme.desc: Documentary following the residents of Uig on the Isle Of Lewis as they strive to transform a disused radar station on the edge of a cliff into a community centre.

programme.title: Mach à Seo!
programme.desc: Ramsay MacMahon sails to the Isle of Eigg, now in its 25th year of community ownership, to find out how this has shaped the island. He passes by the house that JRR Tolkien once stayed in, visits a beach where the sand makes strange squeaking noises underfoot and hikes up Eigg’s iconic an Sgùrr, a striking volcanic ridge, for views across the archipelago and to Skye.

programme.title: Women's Sport 360
programme.desc: Iona Ballantyne presents the show that gets to the heart of remarkable women and empowering stories in Scottish sport.

programme.title: Opry an Iúir
programme.desc: Daniel O'Donnell hosts a country gospel-themed episode from the Millennium Forum in Derry, featuring Cliona Hagan, Michael English, Chloe Agnew, and Patrick Feeney.

programme.title: Africa with Ade Adepitan
programme.desc: Ade explores Tanzania, Ethiopia, and Somalia, visiting a game reserve where efforts are being made to halt the decline of elephant numbers. He tours Addis Ababa with former Olympic champion Haile Gebrselassie to discover why Ethiopia's economy has gone from strength to strength in recent years, and discovers the impact of war on Somalia, meeting a former NHS doctor who has returned to the country to help rebuild.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in Northumbria en route to the Highlands, heading to Kielder Forest to discover what lay behind a national initiative to plant one of the largest manmade woodlands in Europe. Crossing the border to Scotland, Michael arrives in the weaving town of Hawick to visit Lovat Mill, where, in the 1930s, tweed was big business, and also goes to the movies, sitting in the front stalls at the Dominion cinema in Morningside.

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson visits Alnmouth, Northumberland, which was founded in the mid-12th century after the barons of nearby Alnwick obtained a charter from King John to build a new village. It had a market and a small port and the village flourished - so much so that by the mid-1700s, Alnmouth's grain export started to play an integral role in feeding the growing English population.

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Simon Schama charts the dramatic story of the political and religious upheavals in Britain following the death of Charles I. Republican leader Oliver Cromwell envisaged a godly kingdom, while Charles II restored the lustre of the monarchy. Subsequent anti-Catholicism during the brief reign of James II led to a pivotal uprising which would transform the country for ever.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Following the route of the old Caledonian Railway Company, Michael Portillo discovers the 'Riviera of the Highlands'. With a daily direct train service to Kings Cross, Gleneagles remains a top destination and is also headquarters for the British School of Falconry. Berry Town, aka Blairgowrie, is Michael's next stop. At the home of the Scottish raspberry industry, which once sent fruit to London daily on board a raspberry special service from Cooper Angus station, Michael learns how to pick this most delicate of berries. The last stop on this leg is the city of Dundee, where he visits publisher DC Thomson.

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: In the early 19th century Staithes was as one of the largest east coast fishing ports, and even now the harbour building renovations reveal the seaside village's impressive financial boom. Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the harsh North Yorkshire coastline that surrounds Staithes, as he finds out how the village was built to be a safe haven. It was also a settlement rich in the natural resource of shale. Contributors include local author Peter Appleton and fellow archaeologist Caroline Barrie Smith.

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: The presenter introduces the unique talents of the world's most intelligent animals, investigating how nature's masterminds measure up against human brain power. Looking at a variety of animals, such as ravens, crows, bees and starlings, Chris explores how different animals can use tools, solve complex puzzles, recognise themselves in mirrors and even reason like humans.

programme.title: Six Wives with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: Documentary charting key moments in the lives of Henry VIII's wives, combining dramatised scenes with the presenter's own contemporary historical comment. In this episode, Lucy follows Catherine of Aragon through her emotional and physical struggles to give Henry the heir he so desperately needs to continue his dynasty. When Catherine finally gives birth to a baby girl, Henry's eye wanders to the ladies at court - first Mary Boleyn, and then to her sister, Anne.

programme.title: The Six Wives of Henry VIII
programme.desc: Classic drama focusing on the Tudor monarch's relationships with each of his wives. Catherine is widowed at only 16, and after the death of the miserly Henry VII, she marries the young handsome Henry VIII. Could any two people be so much in love? Starring Roger Michell and Annette Crosbie. From 1970

programme.title: The Six Wives of Henry VIII
programme.desc: Classic drama focusing on the Tudor monarch and his wives. Catherine is dead and Anne Boleyn is now queen, but two years on her promise to give Henry a son remains unfulfilled - and the outcome will lead more than one person to the scaffold. Starring Roger Michell and Dorothy Tutin. From 1970

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: The war in Ukraine is the biggest in Europe since World War II. Millions of children have been forced to leave their homes to escape the fighting, but many either others couldn’t or didn’t. Hearing from just some of those who are living through war, this film lets the children caught in the conflict tell their stories in their own words. Covering fear, loss, strength and hope, they detail the life-changing events of the war and the impact it is having on their day-to-day life. They share their experiences of surviving attacks from the air, being forced to live for weeks at a time in bomb shelters, and their towns and villages becoming occupied by Russian soldiers. Ricky Boleto finds out how the children are coping with living in a country at war..

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Sex for Work: The True Cost of Our Tea - Panorama
programme.desc: PG Tips and Lipton's are world-famous tea brands and an undercover investigation reveals that women working on plantations producing them are being pressured to have sex with their bosses in return for work. The report focuses on plantations that have been owned for years by two British companies - Unilever and James Finlay and Company - who between them have produced half the tea drunk in the UK. Reporter Tom Odula has spoken to dozens of women who say they have been sexually assaulted or harassed, while undercover footage reveals how one young woman was targeted for sex at a job interview.

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: The war in Ukraine is the biggest in Europe since World War II. Millions of children have been forced to leave their homes to escape the fighting, but many either others couldn’t or didn’t. Hearing from just some of those who are living through war, this film lets the children caught in the conflict tell their stories in their own words. Covering fear, loss, strength and hope, they detail the life-changing events of the war and the impact it is having on their day-to-day life. They share their experiences of surviving attacks from the air, being forced to live for weeks at a time in bomb shelters, and their towns and villages becoming occupied by Russian soldiers. Ricky Boleto finds out how the children are coping with living in a country at war..

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Sex for Work: The True Cost of Our Tea - Panorama
programme.desc: PG Tips and Lipton's are world-famous tea brands and an undercover investigation reveals that women working on plantations producing them are being pressured to have sex with their bosses in return for work. The report focuses on plantations that have been owned for years by two British companies - Unilever and James Finlay and Company - who between them have produced half the tea drunk in the UK. Reporter Tom Odula has spoken to dozens of women who say they have been sexually assaulted or harassed, while undercover footage reveals how one young woman was targeted for sex at a job interview.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice.

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley present live from the studio in Cardiff, showcasing the work of frontline forces as well as asking for viewers help on unsolved cases.

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: A police officer is assaulted when he follows a suspect into a storm drain and two paramedics are attacked by a drunk man in the back of their ambulance.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A four-bedroom terrace in Saddleworth with a tricky layout, an architecturally important flat in Blackheath and a dilapidated cottage without a bathroom in Treherbert, Wales.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Wrexham, north Wales, with experts Caroline Hawley and Danny Sebastian, and heads to Chester Cathedral to learn how spiders inspired artists.

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: A new doctor ruffles feathers on their first day at the Mill. Kirsty prepares to face her new life - but she may not be ready. Sid worries about a young boy and his older brother.

programme.title: Jay Blades' Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay and his guests demonstrate how to hang a door, upcycle a garden bench, build a laptop stand and create homemade dishwasher tablets.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a green-fingered couple in Gloucestershire find their perfect retreat with plenty of space to enjoy their hobbies, on a budget of £800,000

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Auctioneer Izzie Balmer and jewellery expert Ishy Khan explore the county of Yorkshire, pointing their vintage golden Volvo towards the likes of Knaresborough, York and Harrogate, before heading south for their third auction. They also discover an awful lot of fascinating history along the way, including a trip to a spa and the little-known story of a woman who played a part in setting up some 200 schools around the world.

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Work colleagues Simone, Sarah, Lucille and Virginia compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones on the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Callum's first day gets off to a rocky start and Eve has a heart to heart with Ash. Stacey is on the hunt for extra work. Whitney continues to struggle with her emotions and is unimpressed when Zack offers her some money.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team of experts bring four treasured family heirlooms back to life. First up, Rose Werner and her sister Linda hope that Suzie Fletcher can turn her expertise to a decorative leather box that they hold dear to their hearts. Peter Coxon is next to arrive, hoping the teamwork of Steve Fletcher and Dominic Chinea can provide a speedy recovery to a favourite childhood toy, a tin speed boat. Later, the experts also turn their attention to an Italian dressing table chair and a tortoise pouffe.

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey and the team help the Clark family declutter as they lay out their belongings in a warehouse only to discover they own 521 odd socks, 75 barbies and 28 games controllers. After moving from the US to a much smaller house in the UK the family no longer have the space they need. Carpenter Rob creates some floor to ceiling storage for the family while Dilly reorganises the kitchen and laundry area.

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines.

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.sub-title: My Hindu Coming Out Story - Love, Faith and Me
programme.desc: Anish explores his connection to his Hindu faith as an openly gay man. Hoping to reconnect to his religion, he goes on a journey to see if he can reconcile his faith and sexuality. He also faces his greatest fear by revisiting the school where he experienced homophobic bullying as a teenager to speak to the current students about tolerance.

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The candidates design a new men's skincare product, before pitching it to industry buyers. For one team, wrangling over a recipe leads to a disastrous skin-staining goo, while a lack of creativity on the other side results in an unoriginal concept. Unoriginal concoctions and disastrous recipes almost inevitably lead to a lack of sales. Later, in the boardroom, Lord Sugar is tempted to go beyond his usual single sacking.

Carpenter Rob creates some floor to ceiling storage for the family while Dilly reorganises the kitchen and laundry area.

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines.

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.sub-title: My Hindu Coming Out Story - Love, Faith and Me
programme.desc: Anish explores his connection to his Hindu faith as an openly gay man. Hoping to reconnect to his religion, he goes on a journey to see if he can reconcile his faith and sexuality. He also faces his greatest fear by revisiting the school where he experienced homophobic bullying as a teenager to speak to the current students about tolerance.

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The candidates design a new men's skincare product, before pitching it to industry buyers. For one team, wrangling over a recipe leads to a disastrous skin-staining goo, while a lack of creativity on the other side results in an unoriginal concept. Unoriginal concoctions and disastrous recipes almost inevitably lead to a lack of sales. Later, in the boardroom, Lord Sugar is tempted to go beyond his usual single sacking.

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian returns with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Another three sellers enter the Bidding Room in the hope of persuading the dealers to part with their cash in exchange for their items. programme.desc: Fatemah has still never taken a driving test despite learning to drive for eight years. It has fallen to the 25-year-old's adoring but nerve-shattered dad Akil to instruct her. But as Scarlett Moffatt's experts discover, the driving may not be the problem.

They also discover an awful lot of fascinating history along the way, including a trip to a spa and the little-known story of a woman who played a part in setting up some 200 schools around the world.

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Work colleagues Simone, Sarah, Lucille and Virginia compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones on the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Callum's first day gets off to a rocky start and Eve has a heart to heart with Ash. Stacey is on the hunt for extra work. Whitney continues to struggle with her emotions and is unimpressed when Zack offers her some money.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team of experts bring four treasured family heirlooms back to life. First up, Rose Werner and her sister Linda hope that Suzie Fletcher can turn her expertise to a decorative leather box that they hold dear to their hearts. Peter Coxon is next to arrive, hoping the teamwork of Steve Fletcher and Dominic Chinea can provide a speedy recovery to a favourite childhood toy, a tin speed boat. Later, the experts also turn their attention to an Italian dressing table chair and a tortoise pouffe.

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey and the team help the Clark family declutter as they lay out their belongings in a warehouse only to discover they own 521 odd socks, 75 barbies and 28 games controllers. After moving from the US to a much smaller house in the UK the family no longer have the space they need. Carpenter Rob creates some floor to ceiling storage for the family while Dilly reorganises the kitchen and laundry area.

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines.

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.sub-title: My Hindu Coming Out Story - Love, Faith and Me
programme.desc: Anish explores his connection to his Hindu faith as an openly gay man. Hoping to reconnect to his religion, he goes on a journey to see if he can reconcile his faith and sexuality. He also faces his greatest fear by revisiting the school where he experienced homophobic bullying as a teenager to speak to the current students about tolerance.

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The candidates design a new men's skincare product, before pitching it to industry buyers. For one team, wrangling over a recipe leads to a disastrous skin-staining goo, while a lack of creativity on the other side results in an unoriginal concept. Unoriginal concoctions and disastrous recipes almost inevitably lead to a lack of sales. Later, in the boardroom, Lord Sugar is tempted to go beyond his usual single sacking.

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian returns with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Motsi Mabuse, Jon Richardson, Tom Skinner, Carol Vorderman, Joe Marler, Rav Wilding and Joanne McNally.

He also faces his greatest fear by revisiting the school where he experienced homophobic bullying as a teenager to speak to the current students about tolerance.

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The candidates design a new men's skincare product, before pitching it to industry buyers. For one team, wrangling over a recipe leads to a disastrous skin-staining goo, while a lack of creativity on the other side results in an unoriginal concept. Unoriginal concoctions and disastrous recipes almost inevitably lead to a lack of sales. Later, in the boardroom, Lord Sugar is tempted to go beyond his usual single sacking.

programme.title: The Singer Story: Made in Clydebank
programme.desc: The story of the Singer sewing machine, international icon and a symbol of the Industrial Revolution, and the impact it had on families and households across the world. The programme tells the story of some of the tens of thousands of people employed by the company in Clydebank, and how their lives were intertwined with the fortunes of Scotland's first US 'multi national' company.

programme.title: The Agency: Unfiltered
programme.desc: After losing their biggest sponsor for their huge influencer trip to Ibiza, Amy and Hannah try desperately to secure another backer so that they can realise the trip of their dreams. Meanwhile, the competition between Jess and Charlotte for the role of Kirsten's maternity cover comes to a head. With both of their events done, who will be the winner?.

programme.title: The Disasters That Shocked Scotland
programme.desc: Through archive footage, emotional testimony from those impacted by the events and interviews with journalists who covered the stories, this programme examines two disasters that have shocked the nation - the 1994 Mull of Kintyre helicopter crash and the 2004 fire at Rosepark Care Home.

programme.title: The Nine
programme.desc: The latest Scottish, UK and international news, presented by Rebecca Curran and Martin Geissler.

programme.title: Scotland's Greatest Escape
programme.desc: Father and daughter Graham and Aimee from Dumfriesshire try out three well-being retreats, visiting the elegant Stobo spa, having a close encounter at Sheepy Sleepovers and a staying in a handcrafted Romani caravan at Roulotte Retreat. JJ Chalmers and Grado present.

programme.title: Debate Night
programme.desc: Topical debate on the big issues affecting Scotland and beyond. Members of the public have an hour to put their questions to a panel of politicians and other public figures about the biggest stories and the things they care about the most.

programme.title: Rab C Nesbitt
programme.desc: Rab is still estranged from Mary and finds himself living rough out on the local dump, where he receives sad news about his mother. To make matters even worse, he discovers that Mary has taken in a young and handsome lodger.

programme.title: The Singer Story: Made in Clydebank
programme.desc: The story of the Singer sewing machine, international icon and a symbol of the Industrial Revolution, and the impact it had on families and households across the world. programme.title: The Pig Butchering Romance Scam
programme.desc: Documentary highlighting a fraud in which criminals lure victims into digital relationships to build trust before convincing them to invest in bogus cryptocurrency platforms. The scam invariably begins with the criminal initiating a conversation with victims on a dating app or phishing a text to a random phone number. The fraud's name references the practice of fattening a hog before slaughter.

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: The competition steps up a gear as a new Warrior and Trainee pairing is revealed. The winner of the power challenge sends shockwaves through the group.

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: With elimination looming, the power given to one trainee rocks the group, putting them all at risk of being sent home from the island.

programme.title: People Just Do Nothing
programme.desc: There are potentially double the listeners for Kurupt FM, while duty calls for Beats when Roche goes into labour. Steves has plans with his Nan, leaving Grindah to run the station, and Miche wonders whether there is any chance of her getting back together with her ex.

programme.title: Lazy Susan
programme.desc: There's a medical emergency, a pub trip goes wrong and a man misses his dog. Offbeat sketch show, starring Freya Parker and Celeste Dring.

programme.title: The Fast and the Farmer-ish
programme.desc: The Teutchers take on the Black Reek Pipers in this Scottish heat, with only one team able to represent Scotland in the next round. Hosted by Tom Pemberton.

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: Yianni suggests a chrome pink wrap for a rare supercar being readied for a car rally, but owners Mark and Steve needs some serious persuasion.

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: Customer David asks Yianni and the team to make his two very different cars look uniform, each having a subtle grey wrap and a bold black centre stripe.

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news.

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: The hopefuls meet up at the Selfie Factory in London's O2 for an assignment set in the lucrative world of social media, which sees them creating fun and impactful looks on themselves to be posted on the global video-sharing platform TikTok. But as well as the make-up, they must also film and edit a video - all within the space of two hours. Back in the studio, the online theme continues as they create a look based on a face filter.

programme.title: James Arthur: Out of Our Minds
programme.desc: Middlesbrough-born singer James Arthur opens up about his mental health struggles and issues he has had with antidepressants as he prepares to go out on tour. He also investigates male mental health, speaking to others like him who have found it hard to stop taking antidepressants, but have instead found other ways to help themselves and learn to thrive.

programme.title: The Wedding Fixer
programme.desc: World-class wedding planner Sarah Haywood is in Canterbury with Thomas and Famy, a busy couple who need help with their ambitious but low-cost Indian fusion wedding.

programme.title: The Wedding Fixer
programme.desc: Sarah Haywood helps another couple prepare to tie the knot, only to come up against the bride's mother, who has taken it upon herself to dictate every aspect of the wedding.
