programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Ally tries to open Dave up to new sexual experiences, but inadvertently exposes his deepest, darkest insecurities. Sitcom about a neurotic suburbanite who is convinced he is destined to be a rap star.

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Part two of two. Michael Portillo concludes his journey from Adelaide to Perth, striking gold and playing cards in Kalgoorlie, and uncovering a dark chapter of the past in Perth.

programme.title: Take a Hike
programme.sub-title: Bruce's Walk, Dunvegan and Coral Beach
programme.desc: Comedian and tour guide Bruce hosts the first of five walks on the Isle of Skye in the Inner Hebrides, taking in Dunvegan Castle and its grounds and finishing at Coral Beach.

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: A textile designer from Fife who insists on using sustainable fabrics and a Devon glassblower picking up her craft after an eight-year break try to turn a profit from their skills.

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr take on their first project - designing a Sicilian kitchen. Kicking off the demolition in 36-degree heat proves to be a trial for Alan, and he soon realises that taking on a build in a medieval hilltop town comes with its own unique challenges. With the help of Project Manager Scott, Amanda barters with the locals at a nearby marble factory as she bags a bargain for their feature island and brushes up on her culinary skills in Marsala, learning how to cook Sicily's signature dish.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Sunday Morning Stories
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley discusses the importance of wellbeing, meeting therapy dogs that help children learn to read and visiting the UK's first Muslim Ballet School.

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: Team members inspect an oil tanker the size of two football pitches, which must be examined inch by inch before it is allowed to set sail. With the potential to carry enough crude oil to power a third of the country for a day it is vital they do not miss anything that could mean a disaster in the event of a spillage. Meanwhile, a second team is called out to repair a vital piece of equipment on a cargo ferry that is holding up the transport of vital supplies to a nearby island.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer sets off on a road trip with a new rival, jewellery expert Ishy Khan. They kick off in Kendal, with £200 each, looking for antiques that will make them the most profit.

programme.title: Winterwatch
programme.desc: Michaela Strachan celebrates one of Norfolk's most sensational winter species, pink-footed geese Chris Packham will be catching up on all the action from the live wildlife cameras. In Edinburgh, Gillian Burke and Iolo Williams move to the coast, to showcase Scotland's marine species.

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom..

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 recurring contestants compete for the chance to win a £10,000 jackpot, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the history of the Vegetarian Society and discover how the movement changed public attitudes and became part of the mainstream. They also consider how British gardening has influenced the nation's cuisine, and provide a few recipes along the way.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: The arrival of summer in Yellowstone brings a new challenge for the beavers as their river dries up, forcing the colony to move. As food becomes scarce, the wolves have a surprising strategy to keep their pups fed, while grizzly bears pay an unexpected visit to a cowboy ranch. By midsummer, the hot and dry conditions create a new danger as deadly wildfires threaten to engulf a family of great grey owls. Presented by Kate Humble and Patrick Aryee.

programme.title: Priceless Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents memorable moments from the long-running series, focusing on controversial items. Plus, there is a peek behind the scenes of the Roadshow.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team visit Herstmonceux Castle, where antiques experts Jonathan Pratt and James Lewis find treasures to take to auction, including some beautiful bronze sculptures. Paul Martin takes a trip on a very large miniature railway.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mina Anwar, Glen Moore, Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Shaun Williamson go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week.

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The dive team face one of their smallest but trickiest challenges in the shape of mussels. These small shellfish have blocked the pipes of a huge vessel, stalling it in dock. Now it's up to the divers to blast the mussels out of their hiding places to allow the ship to sail once more.

programme.title: Back in Time for Birmingham
programme.desc: The Sharma's journey enters the 1970s. Opening a shop, they join an explosion of South Asian entrepreneurship in Birmingham, but they soon discover that a shopkeeper's life involves long hours and plenty of manual labour to keep the shop stocked, priced and competitive. Later, Noreen Khan joins the family for a rare evening enjoying an innovative new sound that is sweeping through the Midlands - Bhangra - and the family dance the night away with a band fronted by Bhangra legend Balbir Singh.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: London and South East - Main and Dessert
programme.desc: The chefs from London and the South East serve up their mains and desserts. Dishes include an oven-roasted squab pigeon with pancetta, pumpkin and marsala sauce inspired by Fantastic Mr Fox, and a Peruvian-inspired main celebrating Paddington featuring a spiced sirloin of beef, a short-rib beef and marmalade sandwich. Puddings include an ice gola with passion fruit and pomegranate celebrating The Snowman by Raymond Briggs, and a frozen fennel meringue, gooseberry curd and poppy seed tuile served in a flower pot inspired by Fifi and the Flowertots.

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: In the Leeds Children's Hospital, paediatric consultant Naved Alizai prepares to perform the high-risk and complex operation needed by eight-year-old Ollie, who has a blockage in the blood supply to his liver. If left untreated it could prove fatal. Also on Naved's surgery list is one-year-old Maya Mae, who was born with a large cyst growing in one of the ducts to her liver. At St James's Hospital, endocrine consultants Sheila Fraser and Emma Collins prepare to remove a tumour from the thyroid gland in an 85-year-old patient's neck.

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.sub-title: Wherever You Go, There You Are
programme.desc: Upon discovering that his family has moved on in his absence, Stede vows to make things right with his wife, Mary. After a desperate attempt to stage a show for the crew, Izzy confronts a depressed Blackbeard about his former life.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Victoria Derbyshire.

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather.

programme.title: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas (2008)
programme.desc: Bruno, a boy in Nazi Germany, moves to the country when his father is placed in charge of a concentration camp. While exploring the woods close to the facility's boundary, he spots a Jewish youngster being held there, and the two become friends - but Bruno remains innocently oblivious to the camp's true purpose. Drama, starring David Thewlis, Asa Butterfield and Jack Scanlon.

programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents memorable moments from the long-running series, focusing on controversial items. Plus, there is a peek behind the scenes of the Roadshow.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team visit Herstmonceux Castle, where antiques experts Jonathan Pratt and James Lewis find treasures to take to auction, including some beautiful bronze sculptures. Paul Martin takes a trip on a very large miniature railway.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mina Anwar, Glen Moore, Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Shaun Williamson go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week.

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The dive team face one of their smallest but trickiest challenges in the shape of mussels. These small shellfish have blocked the pipes of a huge vessel, stalling it in dock. Now it's up to the divers to blast the mussels out of their hiding places to allow the ship to sail once more.

programme.title: Back in Time for Birmingham
programme.desc: The Sharma's journey enters the 1970s. Opening a shop, they join an explosion of South Asian entrepreneurship in Birmingham, but they soon discover that a shopkeeper's life involves long hours and plenty of manual labour to keep the shop stocked, priced and competitive. Later, Noreen Khan joins the family for a rare evening enjoying an innovative new sound that is sweeping through the Midlands - Bhangra - and the family dance the night away with a band fronted by Bhangra legend Balbir Singh.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: London and South East - Main and Dessert
programme.desc: The chefs from London and the South East serve up their mains and desserts. Dishes include an oven-roasted squab pigeon with pancetta, pumpkin and marsala sauce inspired by Fantastic Mr Fox, and a Peruvian-inspired main celebrating Paddington featuring a spiced sirloin of beef, a short-rib beef and marmalade sandwich. Puddings include an ice gola with passion fruit and pomegranate celebrating The Snowman by Raymond Briggs, and a frozen fennel meringue, gooseberry curd and poppy seed tuile served in a flower pot inspired by Fifi and the Flowertots.

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: In the Leeds Children's Hospital, paediatric consultant Naved Alizai prepares to perform the high-risk and complex operation needed by eight-year-old Ollie, who has a blockage in the blood supply to his liver. If left untreated it could prove fatal. Also on Naved's surgery list is one-year-old Maya Mae, who was born with a large cyst growing in one of the ducts to her liver. At St James's Hospital, endocrine consultants Sheila Fraser and Emma Collins prepare to remove a tumour from the thyroid gland in an 85-year-old patient's neck.

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.sub-title: Wherever You Go, There You Are
programme.desc: Upon discovering that his family has moved on in his absence, Stede vows to make things right with his wife, Mary. After a desperate attempt to stage a show for the crew, Izzy confronts a depressed Blackbeard about his former life.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Victoria Derbyshire.

programme.title: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas (2008)

Drama, starring David Thewlis, Asa Butterfield and Jack Scanlon.

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr take on their first project - designing a Sicilian kitchen. Kicking off the demolition in 36-degree heat proves to be a trial for Alan, and he soon realises that taking on a build in a medieval hilltop town comes with its own unique challenges. With the help of Project Manager Scott, Amanda barters with the locals at a nearby marble factory as she bags a bargain for their feature island and brushes up on her culinary skills in Marsala, learning how to cook Sicily's signature dish.

programme.desc: Unexplained phenomena occurring across North America's National Parks. This episode explores the apparent forces living in the secret underworld of Death Valley National Park on the California-Nevada border, where a series of deaths and disappearances have taken place.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: Tragedy strikes in the courtroom when a gun ends up in the wrong hands. Meanwhile, a defendant turns on his attorney in a brutal attack, and someone bares all for the judge.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: A judge is threatened by a murder suspect. Meanwhile, there's a savage attack in the courtroom when two sons see red as their mother's killer is sentenced.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Troy and his armada take an overnight trip to the legendary hunting ground, Cow Island. Joey and Zak go on a special mission to protect the Edgar's home town, while Daniel takes matters into his own hands to deal with a poacher. A bad 'fish kill' means easy eating for the gators, forcing RJ and Jay Paul to snipe them from long range.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and a team of antiques dealers visit Derby to offer locals the chance to put their items up for auction or accept a cash sum. James Bond memorabilia is brought to Michael Hogben's table and ancient Egyptian artefacts are a little disappointing for one seller.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.sub-title: Big Cow Trouble in Little Ajax
programme.desc: The grand opening of Paul and Bogart's store finally arrives, but their plans suffer a setback when a new buyer shows up on the scene with money to burn.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick is offered the chance to drive a Second World War tank and he and Corey later inspect some Haunted Mansion memorabilia. Vintage toy soldiers march into the shop, while Chum finds a flamethrower.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.sub-title: May the Pawn Be with You
programme.desc: Rick flies to look at an epic Star Wars collection - including an iconic prop. Will the force be on his side, or will he leave solo?.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth notices that Ashley is behaving strangely - either low-balling on, or rejecting outright, various items that she would otherwise give higher deals on.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley continues to low-ball and mistreat customers to Seth's detriment, and gets involved in an argument in front of a client over a signed 1970 Detroit Tigers baseball.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les's anger over Seth and Ashley's sibling rivalry boils over to the point that he gives them an ultimatum to calm down or be sacked - but they carry on bickering.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les remains in hospital following his collapse, and Seth and Ashley continue manning operations at the pawn shop. However, the bickering continues.

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: An exploration of whether a cache of fantastic riches really could have been buried centuries ago on a tiny island in the North Atlantic. For more than 200 years, treasure hunters have been coming to Oak Island in search of a treasure that has so far eluded them all, and has even cost six men their lives. Could it be that, as legend suggests, the treasure is protected by a deadly curse?.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts check out structures built to mirror the constellations, contemplating whether they may have been built as a message to send to extraterrestrials.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ever since the first atomic bomb went off in 1945, UFOs have been spotted at nuclear facilities across the world. Experts wonder if this presence could be a threat to mankind.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Jeff Schwarz, aka The Liquidator, takes his place as guest auctioneer.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Not All That Glitters Is Gourd
programme.desc: Back in the Californian city of Orange, the Vegas Ladies arrive in vintage style - though not everyone agrees. Casey finds the chutzpah to pick up a good unit. Darrell tries to peddle his wares to Emily, but settles for a decent locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy thinks he's a comedian in Stanton California, but the gizmo in his locker is no joke. Brandi and Jarrod make sure that what they find in their unit doesn't stay there. Kenny's vintage entertainment lands him an excuse to meet a cult TV host.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick tests a Civil War revolver, a piece of memorabilia from Lebron James comes through the doors, and Rick falls hard for a 4,500-year-old meteorite..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick shoots over to England for an explosive chance to test out antique weapons. Then, an item that inspired a classic movie rifles into the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth ignores Ashley's wish to ban a troublesome customer - but his decision threatens to put the shop at risk. Meanwhile, Les commissions a striking masterpiece.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth hatches a plan to get more customers through the pawn shop doors. His new idea backfires, and Les is forced to reconsider his choice of manager.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les's return proves a shock for Seth and Ashley, who have let profits drop in his absence. Back in charge, the manager cuts a deal that could increase profits.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley questions whether the pawn store has a thief in its midst when two teens come in with news of a scam.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate an Italian mountain that has stood witness to inexplicable phenomena for centuries, wondering whether it could somehow be attracting alien visitors.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The idea that aliens may have given human brains incredible untapped abilities. Experts ask whether harnessing these hidden powers could spark the next step in man's evolution..

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: Modern prophets and the concept of predicting the future, in terms of catastrophic premonitions or dreams of future crimes. Assuming such an art is really possible, Shatner questions how such 'talent' could be used to avoid the deadly events waiting in the days to come. Alternatively, he contemplates that the future may simply be an unknowable mystery, unfolding all the time.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: People who make a living from bidding for the contents of abandoned storage units. They have only a few minutes to examine the lockers before deciding whether to make the risky purchase, but they have previously found shrunken heads, work by Picasso and the world's most valuable comic collection.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny is feeling nostalgic in Koreatown, so brings along an old friend - a notion that may or may not be a good idea. Brandi and Jarrod sweeten their profit in an unexpected way. Ivy tolerates the big city in an effort to find some name brand goodies.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his team help members of the public in Colne, Lancashire, determine which of their most treasured possessions are worth the most. Tim Hogarth is given a chance to display his charitable side when a set of medals turns up at his table, Simon Schneider is presented with items by artist Clarice Cliff, and a young couple gives Jo Brayshaw a run for her money.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: From UFOs to poltergeists, some of the most amazing, eye-opening, and downright scary paranormal videos from around the world are featured as a panel of experts break down the footage and analyse what exactly the eyewitnesses captured.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: For decades, the famed Patterson-Gimlin bigfoot film has been touted as the best proof the creature exists. Now using breakthrough AI technology, the film is restored.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: An unidentified creature washed up on the beach, while a strange object is seen over the skies of inner Mongolia. Tony Harris and his team of experts examine new videos and photographs to reach a verdict on what lies behind strange happenings.

programme.title: Strange Evidence
programme.desc: A police dash cam captures a high speed pursuit and an officer is stunned when the erratic fugitive makes an impossible getaway. Deep in Louisiana, cameras record the terrifying moment a swamp devours tall trees..

programme.title: Out of This World
programme.desc: In this episode Dr. Maggie reveals the gamechangers of space - missions and spacecraft from the Space Shuttle to the Hubble Space Telescope that have transformed our lives on earth and beyond. She flew in the space shuttle three times, she delivered Hubble into orbit and was the first American woman to walk in space! Plus, Dr Maggie counts down the Top 5 Most Expensive Missions and all your space questions are answered in Ask Maggie. Buckle up, it's time to go Out Of This World!.

programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Our heroes notice that all the coolest dudes are always surrounded by girls, so they decide to go looking for a girl who wants to hang out with them - after encountering several refusals, Simone finally accepts! However, Simone is no pushover, and through her daring and cunning actions, she teaches the boys a lesson about their macho prejudices by hugely exaggerating all the cliches they have about girls..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Magoo, in the park, believes he's in the Amazon rainforest. programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd is excited to attend the 'hottest party there is' behind the oven after Biggo puts a pizza on - 'hotter' equals 'happier' for Lloyd, but as the street party heats up and insects start to leave, Lloyd insists that there's no such thing as 'too hot'....

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When Lloyd starts behaving very oddly - flying into walls, sitting on his sister, seeing multiples of everything, eating a dishcloth - his family start to suspect that something may be wrong with his senses..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George finds a computer called Val but Val has a mind of her own. Soon she's set about uploading embarrassing videos to social media..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Fuzzypeg eats the Spuds' fish supper and Dave has to catch another. Things look up when he hooks something, but it turns out to be a whale..

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Jump into the Mystery Machine for more comedic mystery-solving adventures with Scooby and the gang. Mystery Inc. encounters a giant gorilla on a rampage while bumping into Jessica Biel in a jungle..

programme.title: Buck and Buddy
programme.desc: A new food source lands in the middle of Toxic Pea Soup Lake, and the battle is on to get there first..

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Shaggy and Scooby take the gang to meet their good friend actor and comedian Kenan Thompson..

programme.title: Tata and Kuma
programme.desc: Madcap animated comedy. Tata is always an obstacle to the Mouse Commandos, who are always looking for food in the waste bins - when a giant snot monster appears to the sleeping Tata, its terrible attack overpowers Tata. However, the scary monster immediately kneels down when he sees the Mouse Commandos....

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.sub-title: Where Exactly On The Globe Is Carl Sanpedro - Part 1
programme.desc: Animated series based on the DC Comics fictional superhero team the Teen Titans. The Titans fly to Los Angeles but end up in San Pedro, where Berto tells them about villainous longshoreman Carl Sanpedro..

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.sub-title: Where Exactly On The Globe Is Carl Sanpedro - Part 2
programme.desc: Animated series based on the DC Comics fictional superhero team the Teen Titans. When Carl Sanpedro strikes in Jamaica, the Titans take off for the Caribbean.

programme.title: DC Super Hero Girls
programme.desc: Leslie Willis, the meanest girl in school, becomes a social media sensation by posting mean-spirited videos on her MetropoVids channel.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: When an intense game of 'The Ground is Lava' breaks out, Craig must carefully traverse the Creek to save his sister..

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Mei is a member of the Dragon Family and a descendant of the Dragon of the West - when Mei is asked to house-sit for her parents, MK begs to come along. General Ironclad, one of the Demon Bull King's minions, hears that the family will be gone and realises that there is an opening to infiltrate the famed Dragon Temple House and steal the legendary Dragon Blade, but Mei defends her home and birth right to wield the sword..

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Pigsy and Tang are taken hostage by the Spider Queen when they go looking for ingredients, so Sandy, Monkie Kid, Mei, and Mo take their new boat down into the sewers to free their friends..

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: When Alan is on space junk duty, one of the pieces of debris turns out to be a heat-seeking SAT-MINE that activates and locks onto TB3's heat signature. Back on Earth, Lady Penelope and Parker sneak into a top-secret storage facility to find the mine's deactivation code.

programme.title: Overlord and the Underwoods
programme.desc: When Willow's girls' soccer team is overlooked, Overlord decides to get involved - for the other team. Flower takes it upon herself to help R0-FL follow her own interests.

programme.title: Drop Dead Weird
programme.desc: Comedy drama following the adventures of an Australian family who move to an isolated seaside village in western Ireland, with the parents having a secret to hide.

programme.title: Makeaway Takeaway
programme.desc: A comedy arts and crafts show for six to 11-year-olds and presented by comedian Bec Hill. The Takeaway is in chaos and Bec needs help organising her paperwork, so she orders a surprising solution... some bubble wrap inspires a Takeaway technique with a 'pop', and a customer has trouble saying goodbye to their favourite pair of old shoes - Bec also makes her mark with a giant pen with just three ingredients, and she creates something fantastic out of plastic for a surfing coach..

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Game show that sees teenage presenter Danny Murphy take on some of the craziest dares, from rock climbing to racing a hovercraft! In this episode, Danny needs all his strength as he faces a 14-metre rock climb, but will he reach the Dare Master flag at the top?.

programme.title: Ted's Top Ten
programme.desc: Comedy series following the misadventures of Ted and his school friends and family. Halloween has gripped the Noonan household as Stu plans for his party spooktacular and Lani's going trick-or-treating with her two daughters - things are complicated, however, when Jada's invited out by her father on the same day that Ted finally secures a date with Rosie Barnes, only for the date to clash not only with Stu's party, but a trick-or-treat session with Penny too. Can Ted be in three places at once?.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Bad Beat of the Blah Borelock
programme.desc: Animated comedy featuring two trouble-making young friends who re-imagine their grumpy headmaster as a superhero looking to fight crime and save their city. In a last-ditch effort to save the summer, the boys convince Krupp to send the kids on a camping trip in the woods - the boys try to rout it, but they discover that it's less fun than they expected. That's the least of their worries, though, when Meaner - in a freak accident - melds with Melvin's VR helmet to become the wizard Borelock....

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Peace has come to Ninjago, and the Ninja are taking a break from training to play video games. After they are scolded by Sensei Wu, Nya comes running in, announcing that Lord Garmadon has returned.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. JC accuses Mo of triggering a huge water fight in the cafeteria, but he's the one who actually started it. As punishment, Mo is assigned to clean the most horrible classroom in the school, so he decides to ask the Sceptre for the power to take on the appearance of whoever he wishes - why? He plans on visiting the principal looking like JC to confess 'his' crime, but the power doesn't just give him JC's appearance - it gives him his personality too!.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mr Brick has been on edge for several days, handing out punishments left and right and piling on the assignments - what's bitten him? The answer comes in just two words - Mrs Uptight! She is the regional head of the educational project The School of the Future and is visiting the school - which is acting as a pilot scheme - to see Mr Brick give a demonstration. When Mr Brick flees the demonstration, Mo and Sam have to find a solution to get Mr Brick to return..

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Jump into the Mystery Machine for more comedic mystery-solving adventures with Scooby and the gang. programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Zoe is the most popular girl in town, so when she tells everyone that she's going to have a party at her place, it's the event of the century! There's one small problem, however - PJ is invited, but his friends aren't. It's trouble in paradise as Issa and Pedro are furious and decide to organise their own fiesta - meanwhile, PJ realises that Zoe's party isn't actually that cool..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Weasel, disguised as a supervillain atop a building under construction, has taken the President hostage. While Fizz prepares to act out a heroic rescue, Magoo appears in a ski suit and mistakes Weasel for a yeti..

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. A bird on the loose indoors sends everyone into hiding - Lloyd, who has been separated from Abacus and trapped in a pen lid with his neighbour Molly, is struggling with the notion of doing nothing and waiting it out, so he starts trying to think up an escape plan..

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd and Abacus are on the hunt for a nice quiet spot to play their favourite board game - the trouble is that everywhere is either too loud, too busy, or too dangerous! They finally find the perfect place... but then they forget to take gravity into account..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud

Twenty two year-old student Yomi, a friend of one of the sentenced teens, investigates how someone with a bright future with no previous offenses can be jailed for sending messages.

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Queens, New York, where he meets a family torn apart by the stress of running failing Greek restaurant Kati Allo. programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds

Newly-weds Matt and Lucia struggled to fit their family into their living space as most of it had been given to their rescued pets, while Baptist minister Chris and Caroline had a severe lack of space in an already-extended property as they regularly host upwards of 14 people in their four-bed home.

programme.title: The Piano
programme.desc: The final stop on the search for Britain's best amateur pianists is Birmingham New Street Station. Featuring a toe-tapping Jerry Lee Lewis hit and a unique Harry Styles cover. There is not a dry eye in the station when a Welsh retiree goes on a trip down memory lane. As per usual, the unsuspecting performers are being watched by Lang Lang and Mika who are looking for a pianist to play at the Royal Festival Hall.

programme.title: Kathy Burke: Growing Up
programme.desc: Kathy Burke contemplates if she should fight or accept old age and asks if it's easier or harder to be young in today's world by speaking to some ordinary people with extraordinary lives. In the first of this two-part special, Kathy examines getting older and how she feels about what is to come in later life, she learns from 85 year-old model Bridget and a 70 year-old dominatrix that raging against the realities that come with old age might be the secret to aging disgracefully and with dignity. Featuring contributions from Bill Bailey and Jennifer Saunders.

programme.title: Bronson: Fit to Be Free?
programme.desc: Charles Bronson is the UK's most notorious prisoner. After serving 48 years in prison, he is due to make his case for release at a parole board hearing held in public - one of the first of its kind. This two-part special gives voice to some of his victims, those closest to Bronson, and various members of the criminal justice system to ascertain whether he is fit to be released.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics are back to tuck into their takeaways while watching the best of the week's TV and streaming output, sharing their thoughts for the rest of the viewing public to see.

programme.title: Jailed Over a Group Chat: UNTOLD
programme.desc: A look into social media and conspiracy law following the sentencing of 10 teenagers who were presented as a gang plotting revenge for their friend's murder based on a group chat they made to grieve and vent. Twenty two year-old student Yomi, a friend of one of the sentenced teens, investigates how someone with a bright future with no previous offenses can be jailed for sending messages.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Queens, New York, where he meets a family torn apart by the stress of running failing Greek restaurant Kati Allo. Husband-and-wife owners Manny and Christine are on the brink of divorce, while their daughter Evelyn is caught in the middle and at her wits' end.

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by comedians Frankie Boyle and Josh Pugh, and TV presenter AJ Odudu for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days. As usual, the hashtag #isitok paves the way for the gang to round up, examine and explain the leading and most entertaining news stories of the week.

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: It's the semi-final and the potters are making pieces for the bathroom before taking on the iconic Moorcroft tube lining in the surprise second challenge. programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp searches for a family home around Hove on the south coast of England for Duncan, Anna and their three children, as they return from seven years living in Switzerland. programme.title: Wonderful World of Baby Animals
programme.desc: On a New Forest farm, twin lambs of the rare Valais Blacknose breed are born, but the second lamb is rejected by his mother and his life seems to be taking a different path to that of his sister. Meanwhile, African elephant calf Nusu is growing up fast, but cannot quite master all of his various appendages, and when he tries to run on muddy ground, he ends up in a heap. Elsewhere, Oberon the Lusitano foal learns the art of dressage, hoping to follow in the hoofsteps of his father and become an Olympic champion.

programme.title: Wonderful World of Baby Animals
programme.desc: Baby three-banded armadillo Ellie goes on her first adventure outside the nest. A Malayan tapir called Megat begins to investigate his world with the help of his short trunk and ostrich chick Oswald performs a whirling dance routine every morning.

programme.title: Building Britain's Canals
programme.desc: Dan Jones examines Britain's most iconic canals, beginning with the 152-mile Grand Union Canal, which runs up the spine of the country. Constructed at the height of the Industrial Revolution, the task challenged even the greatest engineering minds of the time, including pioneers such as James Brindley, the man behind Britain's first commercial canal, and William Jessop, the person with whom responsibility lay for the building of the main link from Birmingham to London. Travelling along its route, Dan experiences first-hand the innovations behind its construction, including the Blisworth tunnel.

programme.title: Jeremy Vine
programme.desc: The broadcaster and guests discuss the issues of the day, with co-host Storm Huntley joining him for phone-ins and reading out viewers' correspondence.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A student studying for her A-levels is struggling to sit at her desk due to pain in her collar bone, a new mother with hip problems comes in to discuss the cocktail of strong painkillers she is taking to manage her pain, and a man has an annoying growth on his head that bleeds whenever he combs his hair. Dr Wynne discusses the available care options with an elderly gentleman who has mixed dementia and his daughter.

programme.title: 5 News at Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Feeling trapped, Bree secretly reaches out for help, only to be discovered by Jacob. Dean is surprised by a face from his past, and Remi takes matters into his own hands.

programme.title: Murder and Matrimony (2021)
programme.desc: When Angie's parents pass away and her estranged brother comes back into her life, her world is turned upside down. Thriller, starring Kristen Vaganos.

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Cumbria native Pat is trying to drum up some extra cash for local animal rescue charity at a car boot sale, while Yorkshireman Phil is off for a lads' day out at the track.

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.sub-title: Big Road Rescue: Emergency Call Out
programme.desc: Father-and-son duo Dave and Adam are under pressure to recover a 100-ton train engine before it sinks into the soft ground. Rookie driver Warren has to move a HGV on the busy M1, while Jim has to rescue a lorry that has become stuck in a ditch.

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports.

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.sub-title: The Gadget Show: Shop Smart, Save Money
programme.desc: Ortis, Georgie and a guest family road-test some brilliant gadgets in the real world, including cameras to help them take great photos and make memorable videos, a compact TV surround sound system, and a gaming monitor which frees up the TV for the rest of the family, all without spending big. Elsewhere, Jon Bentley tests out noise-cancelling headphones with a top DJ and music producer, and Bianca Foley tries out a sustainable electric toothbrush.

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Forest
programme.desc: The warm summer days continue in Dalby and Cropton Forests, and cameras capture the forest's youngsters as they investigate their new surroundings, from fawns nervously exploring, to badger cubs appearing out of their setts for the first time and learning how to play-fight with their siblings. Meanwhile at the beaver pond, cameras follow herons as they lurk by the water and stalk their prey.

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports.

programme.title: The Black Death
programme.sub-title: The Black Death: Bring Out Your Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dan Snow and archaeologist Raksha Dave investigate how the Black Death devastated Britain 700 years ago, killing around three million people across the country. In the first edition, Dan heads to Melcombe Regis in Dorset as he traces the spread of the plague and finds out how the disease reached Britain's shores in 1348. At The Old Operating Theatre in London, Raksha witnesses the horrific symptoms of this deadly disease and the terrifying outcome for those who fell victim to it, and also investigates the recent discovery of mass graves beneath a tranquil London square.

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: It's another busy day for the casualty team with patient numbers unusually high. Sister Rachel is running the shift, and she's under pressure with a shortage of cubicles - to make matters worse, IT systems start to fail across the hospital, causing chaos for patient flow. Urgent treatment is needed for 75-year-old Janet, who's been viciously attacked by a dog and has a large flap of skin hanging from her elbow.

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc: PC Andy Doran chases thieves on the run from a shop robbery in Ellesmere Port, where they have reportedly stolen thousands of pounds worth of goods. When the suspect vehicle is finally spotted 70 miles from the crime scene on the M6, Andy and two other patrols must be quick to stop the criminals before they get away.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain
programme.desc: Documentary examining the child sex abuse ring in the Greater Manchester town, with nine men found guilty of 21 counts of sexual abuse over a two-year period.

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.

programme.desc: Interactive gambling.

programme.title: Wonderful World of Baby Animals
programme.desc: On a New Forest farm, twin lambs of the rare Valais Blacknose breed are born, but the second lamb is rejected by his mother and his life seems to be taking a different path to that of his sister. Meanwhile, African elephant calf Nusu is growing up fast, but cannot quite master all of his various appendages, and when he tries to run on muddy ground, he ends up in a heap. Elsewhere, Oberon the Lusitano foal learns the art of dressage, hoping to follow in the hoofsteps of his father and become an Olympic champion.

programme.title: Wonderful World of Baby Animals
programme.desc: Baby three-banded armadillo Ellie goes on her first adventure outside the nest. A Malayan tapir called Megat begins to investigate his world with the help of his short trunk and ostrich chick Oswald performs a whirling dance routine every morning.

programme.title: Building Britain's Canals
programme.desc: Dan Jones examines Britain's most iconic canals, beginning with the 152-mile Grand Union Canal, which runs up the spine of the country. Constructed at the height of the Industrial Revolution, the task challenged even the greatest engineering minds of the time, including pioneers such as James Brindley, the man behind Britain's first commercial canal, and William Jessop, the person with whom responsibility lay for the building of the main link from Birmingham to London. Travelling along its route, Dan experiences first-hand the innovations behind its construction, including the Blisworth tunnel.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Forest
programme.desc: The warm summer days continue in Dalby and Cropton Forests, and cameras capture the forest's youngsters as they investigate their new surroundings, from fawns nervously exploring, to badger cubs appearing out of their setts for the first time and learning how to play-fight with their siblings. Meanwhile at the beaver pond, cameras follow herons as they lurk by the water and stalk their prey.

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports.

programme.title: The Black Death
programme.sub-title: The Black Death: Bring Out Your Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dan Snow and archaeologist Raksha Dave investigate how the Black Death devastated Britain 700 years ago, killing around three million people across the country. In the first edition, Dan heads to Melcombe Regis in Dorset as he traces the spread of the plague and finds out how the disease reached Britain's shores in 1348. At The Old Operating Theatre in London, Raksha witnesses the horrific symptoms of this deadly disease and the terrifying outcome for those who fell victim to it, and also investigates the recent discovery of mass graves beneath a tranquil London square.

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: It's another busy day for the casualty team with patient numbers unusually high. Sister Rachel is running the shift, and she's under pressure with a shortage of cubicles - to make matters worse, IT systems start to fail across the hospital, causing chaos for patient flow. Urgent treatment is needed for 75-year-old Janet, who's been viciously attacked by a dog and has a large flap of skin hanging from her elbow.
